result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel P Bath was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for early termination upon all fines and restitution being paid.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution $3,955.94 to be paid to as a Condition of Probation. $2,771.94 to Val S. and $1,184.00 to Viktoria S.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with any of the victims in any way or through a third party, unless authorized by Agent.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 12-18-2015 03:30 pm
with exhibits #1-3

Defendant Daniel P Bath in court with Attorney Jeremy J Guza.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for restitution hearing.  State's exhibits #1-3 marked.  State makes opening statements/comments.  Attorney Guza makes statements.  Court finds that Viktoria S. is a victim in this case.  Viktoria S. is sworn-in and testifies.  Cross-examination by Attorney Guza.  Re-direct by the state.  State rests.  No testimony by the defense.  State moves for admission of exhibits #1-3.  Court receives exhibits #1-3.  State gives closing arguments.  Attorney Guza gives closing statements.  Court orders restitution in the amount of $1,184.00 to Viktoria S.  Attorney Guza requests an adjournment of sentencing date so Defendant can pay resitution. Sentencing date is adjourned.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing at 11-11-2015 11:00 am

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Daniel P Bath in court with Attorney Jeremy J Guza.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea hearing.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read-in.  Attorney Guza requests a sentencing date 60 days out so Defendant can complete counseling.  Restitution hearing date is also requested by Attorney Guza as they are contesting portion of restitution being requested by the state.  Court adjourns for sentencing and restitution hearing.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Restitution hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Guza requests Miranda Goodchild hearing.   Court will address on morning of trial.  State requests a witness list from the defense.  Court orders parties to exchange witness lists by the close of business on 9/11/15.   Bail remains as fixed.
